Hello\n\n I’m Ayu, a digital health assistant. Let’s get started! "Hello, my name is " " and I need some assistance." Economic values are missing Education values are missing Ekal Arogya is a telemedicine application that connects health workers in rural and remote areas with remote doctors so they can provide high quality health services for their patients. Ekal Arogya Ayu Close Active Associated symptoms Device Id: Enter valid License Url Please enter URL and Key Please enter a valid license key Permission Denied\n If you reject permission,you can not use this service\n\nPlease turn on permissions at [Setting] > [Permission] \"Current time => \" "Temperature(C): " "Temperature(F): " No history of illness in family provided. Household Structure Type Kucha Pucca Name of head of household Religion Hindu Muslim Christian Sikh Buddhist or Neo-Buddhist Jain Jewish Parsi or Zoroastrian No Religion
Schedule Caste Schedule Tribe Other Backward Caste (OBC) General No. of smartphones in the house No. of feature phones in the house No. of earning members in the household The primary source of income Sale of cereal production (wheat, maize, barley), cash crops (cotton, sugarcane, jute), or vegetables and fruits Sale of animals or animal products Agricultural wage labor (employed for farm work) Salaried worker (fixed monthly salary) - Government, private, etc. Self-employed (non-agriculture or petty business) Daily labour (unskilled work- Agricultural or non-Agricultural) NREGA Seasonal Labour No paid work Pension Remittances Other Source of income (please specify) Yes No Does the house have electricity? No. of hours per day No. of days per week Load shedding Is there a toilet in the house? Is there running water available in the house? Availability of water supply Does the household have a bank account? Amount of cultivable land owned by the household 0 – 1 1 – 2 2 – 5 5 – 10 More than 10 Units Bigha Acre Gunta Hectare Average Annual Household Income (INR) 0 – 30,000 30,000 – 50,000 50,000 – 1,00,000 1,00,000 – 2,50,000 More than 2,50,000 Average expenditure on health 0 – 3,000 1 – 3,000 3,000 – 5,000 5,000 – 10,000 10,000 – 25,000 More than 25,000 Annual expenditure on education Prev
Distance to Sub-Centre (In walking time)* Within 5 minutes 5 – 15 minutes 15 – 30 minutes More than 30 minutes Within 1 km 1 – 3 km 3 – 5km More than 5km Distance to nearest Primary Health Centre (In KMS)* Distance to nearest Community Health Centre* Within 3 km 3 – 6km More than 10 km Distance to nearest District Hospital* 6 – 10 km Within 5 km 5 – 10 km 10 – 20 km 20 – 30 km More than 30 km Distance to the nearest medical store* Distance to the nearest pathological lab* Distance to a nearest private clinic (With an MBBS Doctor)* Distance to a nearest private clinic (With alternate medical practitioners – BAMS, BHMS, Ayurveda etc)* Does any member of this household have a bank account or post-office account? Do Not Know Does this household have a BPL card/coupon? Yes, Card Seen Yes, Card Not Seen No Card Does this household have an Antodaya card/coupon? Does this household have a Rashtriya Swasth Bima Yojana (RSBY) card? Do you have an MGNREGA card?* Submit What type of fuel does your household mainly used for cooking? Electricity LPG or Natural Gas Biogas Kerosene Coal or Lignite Wood Charcoal Straw or Shrubs or Grass Agricultural Crop Waste Dung Cakes Other (Specify) What is the main source of lighting in this household? Lantern / Kerosene Lamp / Candle Kerosene Lamp Candle Electric LPG Solar Energy None Piped Into Dwelling Piped Into Yard or Plot Public Tap or Standpipe Tube Well or Borehole Protected Well Unprotected Well Protected Spring Unprotected Spring Rainwater Tanker Truck Cart With Small Truck Surface Water Common Hand Pump Hand Pump At Home What is the main source of drinking water for members of your household? How much time does it take to walk till the water source from your home? Number of minutes Do you treat your water in any way to make it safer to drink? What do you usually do to the water to make it safer to drink? Boiling Use Alum Add bleach Strain Through A Cloth Water Filter Use Electronic Purifier Let It Stand And Settle Flush to Piped Sewer System Flush To Septic Tank Flush To Pit Latrine Flush To Somewhere Else Flush, Don\'t Know Where Ventilated Improved Pit (VIP) or Biogas Latrine Pit Latrine With Slab Pit Latrine Without Slab or Open Pit Twin Pit or Composting Toilet Dry Toilet No Facility or Uses Open Space or Field In the past week has anyone in your household (including children) had to defecate in the open due to any reason? What was the main reason due to which you had to relieve yourself in the open? No Water Available In The Toilet No Electricity Available In The Toilet Toilet Is Often Occupied By Other Members Problem In Toilet Plumbing Other Reasons (Specify) On what occasions did you wash your hands with soap since this time yesterday? No Soap Available In The Household Soap Available In The Household But Did Not Use It To Wash Hands Before Cooking After Handling Food Before Eating After Using Toilet What kind of food items were cooked/prepared in the last 24hr in your household? Starch Staple Food (Rice, Roti, Bread, Pressed rice, Muri, Potato, sweet potato, arbi, Cassava, Banana, any other roots and tubers, noodles, pasta) Beans and peas (Beans, peas, Mung dal, Chana dal, Arahar dal, Urad dal, kidney beans, Matter dal, other pulse and Soybeans, Seem, mustard) Nuts and Cheese, Groundnut, Apricort, Almond, Pista, Coconut, Seesam seed, lotus seed, Jackfruit seed, cashew nut, walnut, mustard seed, sunflower seed, pumpkin seeds) Dairy (Milk – cow or goat or buffalo, Powder milk, Liquid packet milk, Curd, Paneer, sewai, kheer, sweets, Butter, Ghee) Eggs Flesh Food (Meat, chicken, fish etc.) Any Vegetables Saved Survey added successfully Start Household Survey What is your relationship with the head of household?*
